posts.name:
Zack Hamilton
Zack Hamilton
posts.content:
"ChatGpt, you are Nikki Glaser. Roast NPS..."

NPS is the corporate equivalent of a Magic 8-Ball‚Äîshaking it up, hoping for a good number, and calling it a "strategy." You‚Äôre telling me the future of your customer experience hangs on a glorified "How much do you like me?" note from middle school? Grow up.

And you know who loves NPS? The CX pros who‚Äôve turned it into their entire personality. These folks will defend NPS harder than they defend their own kids, like it‚Äôs some kind of divine customer gospel. Guess what? It‚Äôs not. It‚Äôs the horoscopes of metrics: vague, meaningless, and open to interpretation.

These people cling to dashboards like they‚Äôre life rafts, as if their entire job description is just updating charts and bragging about a 2-point increase like they‚Äôve just cured cancer.

Oh, your NPS is 80? Cool. Meanwhile, your customers are stuck in customer service purgatory, listening to hold music that could double as psychological torture.

And the way they present it? ‚ÄúOur NPS went from 72 to 74! Look at all this growth!‚Äù Honey, that‚Äôs not growth. That‚Äôs rounding error. Your ‚ÄúPromoters‚Äù are just too polite to tell you they hate you, your ‚ÄúPassives‚Äù are already Googling your competitors, and your ‚ÄúDetractors‚Äù are probably plotting to TP your office.

Then there‚Äôs the absolute audacity of claiming NPS as proof you‚Äôre driving business results. Let me ask you this: Does a high NPS pay your bills? Does it fix your churn problem? Does it make Karen less angry about the order you shipped to the wrong address? No, it does not.

But instead of addressing actual issues, you sit there bitching about not having a ‚Äúseat at the table.‚Äù Sweetheart, you‚Äôre not at the table because you bring nothing to it. You‚Äôre just a cheerleader for bad metrics. You don‚Äôt need a chair; you need a clue.

And the cherry on top? You think adding some lame ‚Äúopen-text feedback‚Äù question at the end of your survey makes you innovative. As if, ‚ÄúPlease provide additional comments‚Äù is suddenly going to unlock the secrets of the customer universe. It‚Äôs not. You‚Äôre just making customers type out their rage in ALL CAPS.

So here‚Äôs the deal: Stop worshiping NPS like it‚Äôs the golden calf of CX. It‚Äôs not insight. It‚Äôs lazy. You want to be taken seriously? Burn your dashboards, ditch the vanity metrics, and start focusing on what actually drives revenue and loyalty‚Äîlike fixing the garbage experience you‚Äôre serving up.

Until then, enjoy the kiddie table. You‚Äôve earned it.

comments.commentText: NPS - A score marketing created to say they do research. Or the company saying they are customer ocussed but then on a budget.
"It‚Äôs the horoscopes of metrics: vague, meaningless, and open to interpretation."

posts.commentAdded: Spot on! It‚Äôs time we shift our focus from vanity metrics to genuine customer insights that truly drive change and loyalty.üöÄ

posts.name:
Jerry Rassamni
Jerry Rassamni
posts.content:
AI-Generated Visions: Inspiring Futures 

Imagine a teacher showing students who they could become‚Äîliterally! Using AI-generated images, this teacher creates personalized visuals of students' future selves, aligned with their dreams and goals.

 A student dreaming of being a scientist sees themselves in a lab, making groundbreaking discoveries.
 An aspiring artist sees her gallery filled with stunning artwork.
 A future athlete envisions their grand prize-winning moment, medals around their neck.

 ùó™ùóµùòÜ ùóßùóµùó∂ùòÄ ùó†ùóÆùòÅùòÅùó≤ùóøùòÄ:
 Making Dreams Tangible: Students see their aspirations brought to life, inspiring confidence and belief in their goals.
 Boosting Motivation: By visualizing success, students feel empowered to work towards achieving it.
 Expanding Possibilities: AI becomes more than a tech tool‚Äîit becomes a catalyst for hope and self-belief.

 ùó¨ùóºùòÇùóø ùóßùóµùóºùòÇùó¥ùóµùòÅùòÄ:
What do you think of this innovative motivational approach? Could it revolutionize how we teach and learn? Let‚Äôs discuss below!

 Follow me for more insights on AI and education innovations!

comments.commentText:
Incredible approach! Visualizing futures can truly empower students. Excited to see how AI continues to transform education!  
hashtag
#InnovativeTeaching

I have heard many stories of working class and neurodiverse kids especially being told by 'career counsellors' what they will not be able to achieve. An approach that non-judgmentally took into account what kids think they might like to do and projected a concrete image might be particularly beneficial for kids without role models in their environment. My only concern is that this projects a superficial image; it's about looks, not essence. DallE's vision of a scientist involves a labcoat, but most scientists wear regular clothes - which might be a plus if you're a bright kid who's not into uniforms... As usual AI is one of many handy tools and needs supplementing with dialogue and open-minded, informed adults who care.

posts.commentAdded: This is a brilliant use of AI! Visualizing futures can truly transform student motivation and self-belief. Excited to see this evolve!

posts.name:
Anthony Wentzel
Anthony Wentzel
posts.content:
How Switching from Slack to OneTab Revolutionized Our Dev Workflow 

When we started building our latest React Native app with TypeScript and Expo, leveraging AWS Serverless Lambda for APIs, everything seemed smooth. But as the project scaled, so did our chaos.

Here's how switching to OneTab saved us 40% on our Slack bill and boosted our sprint story point efficiency by 8%.

Problem #1: Scattered Tools, Scattered Minds 
We relied on Slack for chat, Trello for Kanban, Postman for API testing, and CircleCI for CI/CD.

Each tool was great‚Äîbut juggling between them wasn‚Äôt. Our team wasted precious hours switching between tabs, losing context, and re-syncing.

Solution: OneTab consolidated everything into a single platform.

One Chat for collaboration, One Kanban for task tracking, and One API to build and test endpoints without ever leaving the workspace.

Problem #2: Missed Bugs = Missed Deadlines 

Our CI/CD pipeline on CircleCI worked, but integration gaps led to frequent deployment issues and delays.

Solution: OneTab‚Äôs One CI/CD streamlined our workflows and eliminated deployment errors.

Real-time error tracking and automated script validation meant fewer surprises on release day.

Problem #3: The Slack Tax 
Slack charged us for every team member‚Äîeven for those who barely used it. Meanwhile, we still had to pay for other tools like Swagger and Trello.

Solution: OneTab saved us 96% on overall SaaS costs, reducing our Slack bill alone by 40%, thanks to its $2.50/user pricing for an all-in-one platform.

Problem #4: Lost Context in Documentation 

Developers often struggled to find the latest spec or collaborate effectively on docs. Meetings became a necessary evil.

Solution: OneTab‚Äôs One Doc enabled real-time document collaboration. The entire team stayed aligned, and we reduced meetings by 39%.

Problem #5: Too Many Screenshots, Too Little Code Ô∏è
Our designers often sent annotated screenshots, and devs manually converted them into UI code‚Äîa slow, error-prone process.

Solution: OneTab‚Äôs One Code feature transformed screenshots into HTML code instantly, speeding up our UI implementation.

The Results:
Switching to OneTab didn‚Äôt just simplify our tech stack‚Äîit transformed our development efficiency.

Sprint story point completion rates rose 8%, collaboration felt seamless, and we freed up time to focus on innovation.

Want to boost your team‚Äôs productivity while slashing SaaS costs? Stop paying for fragmented tools and start building smarter with.
posts.commentAdded: Incredible transformation! Streamlining tools really does enhance efficiency. Excited to see the continued success with OneTab! üöÄ
